
This data set contains a cat scan of a bonsai (thanks to Xiaoyu Yuan
for providing the transfer function).  The resolution of the data set is:

 x_res = 256
 y_res = 256
 slices = 128

For this object there is a unique color and opacity for each density
stored in the file.  Although the density is stored on a 0.0 to 1.0
range, there are only 256 unique densities in this object.  The
mapping between these 256 densities and the matching color and opacity
is given below.  To index into this mapping you will need to multiply
the stored density by 255.  The four columns in the mapping contain
the following values (in order):

density  red  green  blue  opacity
0 0 0 0 0
1 1 17 0 0
2 2 34 0 0
3 4 51 1 0
4 5 69 1 0
5 6 86 1 0
6 7 87 1 0
7 8 89 2 0
8 9 90 2 0
9 11 91 2 0
10 12 93 2 0
11 13 94 2 0
12 14 96 3 0
13 15 97 3 0
14 16 99 3 0
15 18 100 3 0
16 19 102 3 0
17 20 103 4 0
18 21 103 4 0
19 22 103 4 0
20 23 103 4 0
21 25 103 5 0
22 26 103 5 0
23 27 103 5 0
24 28 103 5 0
25 29 103 5 0
26 30 102 6 0
27 32 102 6 0
28 33 102 6 0
29 34 102 6 0
30 35 102 6 0
31 36 102 7 0
32 37 102 7 0
33 39 102 7 0
34 40 102 7 0
35 41 102 8 0
36 42 102 8 0
37 43 102 8 0
38 44 102 8 0
39 46 102 8 0
40 47 101 9 0
41 46 101 9 0
42 45 101 9 0
43 44 101 9 0
44 43 101 10 0
45 42 101 10 0
46 41 101 10 0
